### Tweet 2 (Setup)
Context: I'm in Georgia (the country, not the state).

Got here for 40 cents on a marshrutka from Batumi. Paid $3 to get in.

I was skeptical. Super skeptical.

I thought it'd be just... foundations. Stones on the ground. Imagination work.

### Tweet 3 (Discovery)
The moment I stepped inside, I felt it.

900 meters of walls. 18 towers still standing. And you can CLIMB them. Like, actually climb the stone staircases Roman soldiers used.

Touch the same walls they touched.

Most historical sites rope everything off.

Not here.

### Tweet 4 (Sensory Detail)

Roman footsteps.
Byzantine footsteps.
Ottoman footsteps.

All these empires, all these soldiers climbing the exact same stairs.

### Tweet 6 (History in Layers)
Here's what blew my mind.

You can literally see history in LAYERS.

Middle: Byzantine reinforcements
Top: Ottoman mortar

Three empires. One wall. All visible. All right here.

I stared at this for 20 minutes.
